channel.title: Custom Items Help
channel.description:
Hey guys im not gonna quit on this but im trying to add customs to a server or in the luckscape source 2 of the whips go into the arrow spot does anyone know how to fix this??
and another problem is i look a TUTs on how to add customs but most of my clients dont have the class8.java ? please someone give me some suggestions?
Last is the shops ive tried and tried but nothing works ive been looking forever its getting frustrating i really want to learn this shit...
anyone help via teamviewer?

item.title: Custom Items Help
item.dc:creator: @tchandle tchandle
item.description:
@tchandle wrote:

mr extremez:

OR he has an itemdef because luckscape has an itemdef.

This. Also when you get the ints change it from “class8.” to “Itemdef.”.

Read full topic

item.title: Custom Items Help
item.dc:creator: @i_kik_babiez i kik babiez
item.description:
@i_kik_babiez wrote:

well when u download the luckscape client… the cache was in the client… but when i deleted it and redownloaded… the cache wasnt in the client… so now i have to download the cache, client, and source… cant i combine the cache and client together like the way it came or do i have to put the cache in my c: drive?

and ok i did those steps so if there is a class8 file then u decompile it?

Read full topic

item.description:

item.title: Custom Items Help
item.dc:creator: @i_kik_babiez i kik babiez
item.description:
@i_kik_babiez wrote:

well ok here is what happend… when i downloaded the client and source the cache was in the client files… but i deleted the client and the source but now when i download it only the client files come in and i have to download the cache seperately… soo do i combine the cache with the client like before or leave the cache in my :c drive?

and how do i check if its hidden and can u give me a link to a decompiler?

Read full topic

item.title: Custom Items Help
item.dc:creator: @I_need_a_username I need a username
item.description:
@I_need_a_username wrote:

If there is a class8.class you can decompile it using JAD
But first see if it is hidden.

item.title: Custom Items Help
item.dc:creator: @someone2 someone2
item.description:
@someone2 wrote:

If there isn’t a class8 file it’s

  1. Hidden
  2. The client is not open source.

Read full topic
